description: The Kremlin has blasted Finland for closing the crossing between the two nations, after Helsinki accused Russia of sending undocumented migrants over the border.
maintext:
Ramzan Kadyrov is the head of the Chechen Republic
Russia has accused its neighbour Finland of making a "big mistake" in a spine-chilling threat, after the Nordic country revealed it planned to close four border crossings separating itself with its eastern neighbour.
Finland has accused the Kremin of funneling undocumented migrants over the border and in response announced that it would be taking action to prevent this from continuing.
This comes in the aftermath of Finland's decision to join NATO.
Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov accused the Finnish of choosing to be confrontational with Russia, telling the state news agency TASS: "(One can) only express deep regret that the Finnish authorities have taken the path of destroying bilateral relations.
"Russia has never in modern history threatened Finland, we had no reason for any confrontation. Now they have chosen this path. From our point of view, this is a big mistake."

title: Ukraine war LIVE: Russia's chilling warning after border closed - 'big mistake'
